paper.title: Integration of Structured Analysis and Timed Statecharts for Real-Time and Concurrency Specification
paper.abstract: SA-RT-IM (Structured Analysis with Real-Time extensions and Information Modelling) is a graphical requirements analysis method, combining well-known techniques like data flow diagrams, state transition diagrams, and the entity relationship model. Despite being widespread, SA-RT-IM suffers from considerable drawbacks: It does not always express concurrent control clearly, it lacks in specifying real-time constraints, and its syntax and semantics are defined incompletely and ambiguously. Our improvements shall remove these disadvantages: We use Timed Statecharts for the specification of concurrent and timed control processes, introduce additional control flow types and data flow attributes, use finite automata for defining precise semantics of data and control processes, and develop a table specifying the activation condition of a data process.
